00002         require_once(dirname(__FILE__) . "/../include/common.inc.php");
00003 
00008         class Filesystem
00009         {
00018                 public static function filesize_readable ($file, $retstring = null)
00019                 {
00020                         if (!self::file_exists($file))
00021                         {
00022                                 return l("No such file");
00023                         }
00024                         $size = filesize($file);
00025                         // adapted from code at http://aidanlister.com/repos/v/function.size_readable.php
00026                         $sizes = array('B', 'kiB', 'MiB', 'GiB', 'TiB', 'PiB', 'EiB', 'ZiB', 'YiB');
00027                         if ($retstring === null) { $retstring = '%01.2f %s'; }
00028                         $lastsizestring = end($sizes);
00029                         foreach ($sizes as $sizestring) {
00030                                 if ($size < 1024) { break; }
00031                                 if ($sizestring != $lastsizestring) { $size /= 1024; }
00032                         }
00033                         if ($sizestring == $sizes[0]) { $retstring = '%01d %s'; } // Bytes aren't normally fractional
00034                         return sprintf($retstring, $size, $sizestring);
00035                 }
00036                 
00042                 public static function filesize($file)
00043                 {
00044                         if (!file_exists($file))
00045                         {
00046                                 return 0;
00047                         }
00048                         return filesize($file);
00049                 }
00050                 
00056                 public static function file_exists($file)
00057                 {
00058                         return file_exists($file);
00059                 }
00060                 
00067                 public static function md5_sum($file, $raw = FALSE)
00068                 {
00069                         if (!file_exists($file))
00070                         {
00071                                 return NULL;
00072                         }
00073                         return md5_file($file, $raw);
00074                 }
00075         }
